intro: Callitriche platycarpa var. serpyllifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf water starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Haloragaceae family. It is characterized by its small, floating or submerged leaves that are typically narrow and linear. The plant produces tiny, white to greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in freshwater environments such as ponds, ditches, and slow-moving streams. Its reproductive strategy involves both sexual reproduction through seeds and vegetative propagation via runners.
